BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: COUNCIL OF FAMILY AND CHILD CARING

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION IS ACTIVELY COMMITTED TO STRENGTHENING FAMILIES, CHILDREN & COMM. THROUGH STRATEGIC ADVOCACY, EDU. & THE PROMOTION OF QUALITY, CULTURALLY COMPETENT SVCS. IN NYS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE COUNCIL OF FAMILY AND CHILD CARING AGENCIES (COFCCA) IS ACTIVELY COMMITTED TO STRENGTHENING CHILDREN, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES THROUGH STRATEGIC ADVOCACY, EDUCATION AND THE PROMOTION OF QUALITY, CULTURALLY COMPETENT CHILD WELFARE AND JUVENILE JUSTICE SERVICES IN THE STATE OF NEW YORK. COFCCA SEEKS TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS BY WORKING TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF ITS MEMBER AGENCIES TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY SERVICES.THE COUNCIL OF FAMILY AND CHILD CARING AGENCIES IS THE PRINCIPAL REPRESENTATIVE FOR NEARLY ALL THE NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS PROVIDING FOSTER CARE, ADOPTION, FAMILY PRESERVATION AND SPECIAL EDUCATION SERVICES IN NEW YORK STATE. WITH ABOUT 105 MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS, THE ORGANIZATION WORKS WITH ITS MEMBERS AND GOVERNMENT TO ENSURE QUALITY SERVICES FOR THE MOST VULNERABLE CHILDREN - CHILDREN WHO HAVE SUFFERED ABUSE AND ABANDONMENT AND CHILDREN AT RISK.
IRS990.Desc: COORDINATION AND PLANNING - WORKING WITH APPROXIMATELY 105 MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS AND GOVERNMENT TO PROMOTE AND ENSURE QUALITY SERVICES FOR CHILDREN WHO HAVE SUFFERED ABUSE AND ABANDONMENT AND CHILDREN AT-RISK.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: TRAINING CONSORTIUM - FOR NYC VOLUNTARY AGENCIES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COUNCIL WAS INCORPORATED IN THE STATE OF NEW YORK AND IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE CODE), AND THEREFORE HAS MADE NOPROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IN THE ACCOMPANYING COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. IN ADDITION, THE COUNCIL HAS BEEN DETERMINED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE (IRS) NOT TO BE A "PRIVATE FOUNDATION" WITHIN THE MEANING OF SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. THERE WAS NO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME FOR 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COUNCIL OF FAMILY & CHILD CARING AGENCIES IS A MEMBERSHIP ORGANIZATION OF MOST OF THE VOLUNTARY, NOT FOR PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN NEW YORK STATE PROVIDING FOSTER CARE, ADOPTION, FAMILY PRESERVATION, JUVENILE JUSTICE, AND SPECIAL EDUCATION SERVICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS ELECT THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ANNUALLY AT THE MEMBERSHIP MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS REVIEW AND VOTE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S ANNUAL BUDGET AND MUST ALSO APPROVE ANY DUES INCREASES AND MAY AMEND THE BYLAWS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO GOVERNING BODY, AND AN OPPORTUNITY IS PROVIDED FOR MEMBERS TO ASK QUESTIONS AND MAKE COMMENTS. QUESTIONS AND COMMENTS ARE HANDLED BY FINANCE PERSONNEL AND AUDIT FIRM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS ARE COMPLETED BY OFFICERS, BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES, UPON APPOINTMENT AND ANNUALLY THEREAFTER AND THE POLICY REQUIRES DISCLOSURE FOR ANY ARISING CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS COMMITTEE ON RETENTION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR REVIEWED CEO'S PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS FROM THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND FINALIZED THE PERFORMANCE APPRAISAL OF THE CEO. THE COMMITTEE DETERMINED TO MAINTAIN THE CURRENT SALARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
OTHER FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 228,796. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 43,510. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 272,306.

THE RETURN IS BEING AMENDED SINCE THE COUNCIL OF FAMILY AND CHILD CARING AGENCIES' FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT WAS NOT COMPLETED BY THE ORIGINAL EXTENDED DUE DATE OF THE RETURN. AS A RESULT, ADUSTED AND UPDATED INFORMATION FROM THE PREVIOUSLY FILED RETURN FOR THE SAME PERIOD HAS BEEN REPORTED IN THIS AMENDED RETURN.
